recipe.name: Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipe.description: Crispy edges, chewy centers, and loaded with chocolate chips. The ultimate chocolate chip cookie recipe that never fails.
recipe.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.

3. In a large bowl, beat softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.

4. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla extract.

5. Gradually stir in flour mixture until just combined. Don't overmix!

6. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts (if using).

7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased cookie sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.

8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown around the edges.

9. Let cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

10. Store in airtight container for up to 1 week.
recipe.notes: For chewier cookies, slightly underbake them. For crispier cookies, bake an extra minute or two. The dough can be refrigerated for up to 3 days or frozen for up to 3 months. Sea salt flakes sprinkled on top before baking add a gourmet touch!
